benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from bundle

covered: Path parameter validation (UUID format) and truncated/invalid bundleId checks are covered (TC06, TC22).
Non-existent bundle handling (404) and database-empty state are covered (TC07, TC23).

Query-parameter behaviours are well exercised: no customField -> remove all (TC01), single customField (TC02), multiple customField entries (TC03), invalid/empty customField values (TC09, TC19), deletion of a non-present customField (idempotent, TC10), and ignoring unsupported extra params (TC11).

Required and optional headers: X-Killbill-CreatedBy required / missing header check (TC08); optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment handled (TC04, TC18); header injection and comment length edge-cases are covered (TC14, TC20, TC21).
Authentication failure handling (invalid/expired token -> 401) is covered (TC13).
Success response semantics (HTTP 204 No Content) and post-deletion verification via GET are exercised in multiple tests (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05, TC25).
Error and integration failure handling is covered: service unavailable (TC12) and degraded dependent service (TC24) scenarios are present.
Concurrency and performance are explicitly tested (concurrent delete TC16; heavy-load removal performance TC15).
Data consistency and regression checks are included (no cross-bundle side effects TC17; DB consistency after removal TC25).
gaps: "Produces: application/json" is not asserted anywhere — tests do not validate response Content-Type or clarify behavior for 204 No Content responses (should there be a body/header?).
Authorization / permission (403 Forbidden) scenarios are not covered — tests only cover authentication failure (401) but not insufficient-permission cases.
Caching behavior and headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on the subsequent GETs are not tested (GET-related guidelines not covered).
Pagination for GET listing of custom fields (large datasets) is not covered — no tests for paginated responses or behavior with page/limit parameters.
Rate limiting / throttling behavior is not tested (no 429 or similar scenarios).
Soft-delete semantics are not checked — tests do not verify whether the record is hard-deleted vs flagged (no DB-level soft-delete verification).
Handling of duplicate customField parameters in the same request (e.g., repeated identical UUIDs) or comma-separated lists is not tested.
Audit/logging side-effects of required headers (X-Killbill-CreatedBy / Reason / Comment) are not asserted — no tests validate audit events or DB audit entries.
Error response payload schema/content is not consistently validated (tests assert presence of an error message in some cases but do not validate a consistent schema or fields).
Duplicate submission idempotency beyond concurrency is not explicitly tested (retry semantics, sequential duplicate requests not covered).
recommendations: Add assertions for response headers: explicitly check Content-Type on success and error responses and clarify expected behavior for 204 No Content with respect to "Produces: application/json".
Add authorization tests for users with insufficient privileges to ensure a 403 Forbidden (or documented equivalent) is returned when appropriate.
Add caching tests on the GET verification calls: verify ETag is returned, validate conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match) and Cache-Control headers.
Add pagination tests for GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields (when listing many custom fields) to validate page/limit handling and correctness for large result sets.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests (burst of requests) to verify 429 or service-specific throttling behavior and graceful degradation.
Add tests that verify soft-delete semantics or the lack thereof (e.g., verify DB flags, tombstones, or that physical rows are removed) and ensure the API behavior matches product requirements.

Add tests for duplicate/ambiguous input forms: repeated identical customField query params, comma-separated lists, and extremely long customField values to validate input handling and deduplication semantics.
Add tests that validate audit records / event emissions include X-Killbill-CreatedBy, X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment where applicable (system audit trail verification).
Standardize and assert error response schema (fields, codes, machine-readable error codes) across 4xx/5xx tests so clients can rely on consistent error payloads.
Add idempotency/retry tests for sequential duplicate deletions (re-sending the same DELETE request) to ensure stable behaviour beyond the concurrent case.
